Judul: Anti-ice and snow coating for EDP Distribui����o���s overhead lines
Abstrak:
EDP (Energias de Portugal) Distribuição is interested in analysing competitive solutions that help
reducing the impact of ice and snow on its overhead power lines. In this context, EDP Distribuição has been
working with Instituto Superior Técnico (IST) in the development of an innovative icephobic coating that may be
applied on conductors of already existing high-voltage (HV) or medium-voltage (MV) overhead power lines, in
order to prevent ice and snow accretion. Building on EDP Distribuição’s requirements, IST developed
seven different solutions based on nanocomposite materials. These were applied onto small ACSR 50 conductor
samples that were placed at a high altitude location in Serra da Estrela. The team has been registering
accretion on bare and coated sample conductors, in order to assess the effectiveness of the solutions and
aging impact on their behaviour. The performance of the most promising solution will be assessed in a pilot
experience on a critical overhead power line, using load cells that will permanently measure the mechanical
tension of both coated and uncoated conductors. This study gives an overview of the problem, existing market
solutions and describes the innovative coatings developed by IST and EDP Distribuição, as well as the results
obtained so far.
Sumber: 24th International Conference & Exhibition on Electricity Distribution (CIRED)
